questions.question: How do you feel about raising the minimum wage?
questions.description: The minimum wage is the lowest amount a worker can be paid per hour. Raising it means increasing this baseline pay.

questions.question: What is your stance on government intervention to control inflation?
questions.description: Inflation is the rate at which the general level of prices for goods and services rises. Government intervention includes measures like adjusting interest rates and controlling money supply.

choices.value: Essential, government should actively manage the economy
Government should stay out of the economy

questions.question: How important is it to you to support small businesses through government policies?
questions.description: Supporting small businesses means creating policies that help them thrive, such as tax breaks and grants.

questions.question: Do you support higher taxes on the wealthy to reduce income inequality?
questions.description: This involves increasing taxes on the rich to help distribute wealth more evenly across society.

questions.question: Should the government invest in infrastructure projects (roads, bridges, internet) to stimulate the economy?
questions.description: Investing in infrastructure involves government spending on public projects to boost economic activity.

choices.value: No, the private sector should handle it

questions.question: Do you believe in expanding the Affordable Care Act (ACA)?
questions.description: The Affordable Care Act (ACA) is a health reform law aimed at expanding insurance coverage and reducing healthcare costs.

questions.question: Should the government negotiate prescription drug prices with pharmaceutical companies?
questions.description: Negotiating drug prices means the government would directly discuss and set prices for medications with pharmaceutical companies to lower costs.

choices.value: No, and reduce government involvement further

questions.question: Do you support a single-payer healthcare system (Medicare for All)?
questions.description: A single-payer system means the government provides healthcare for everyone, funded by taxes.

questions.question: How important is it to ensure everyone has access to affordable healthcare?
questions.description: Ensuring access to affordable healthcare means making sure that all individuals can afford medical services.

questions.question: Should the government provide healthcare coverage for undocumented immigrants?
questions.description: This involves offering healthcare services to individuals who are in the country illegally.

choices.value: No, they should not receive coverage
No, and reduce services for immigrants in general

questions.question: How urgent is addressing climate change to you?
questions.description: Climate change refers to long-term changes in temperature and weather patterns, primarily due to human activities.

questions.question: Should the US invest heavily in renewable energy sources?
questions.description: Renewable energy sources include wind, solar, and hydro power, which are sustainable and environmentally friendly.

questions.question: Do you support rejoining international climate agreements like the Paris Accord?
questions.description: The Paris Accord is an international treaty aimed at reducing carbon emissions to combat climate change.

questions.question: Should the government impose stricter regulations on carbon emissions?
questions.description: Stricter regulations on carbon emissions would limit the amount of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases that industries can emit.

choices.value: Yes, but with flexibility for businesses

questions.question: How important is it to invest in climate resilience (e.g., flood defenses, wildfire prevention)?
questions.description: Investing in climate resilience means preparing for and mitigating the impacts of climate change, such as floods and wildfires.

questions.question: What is your stance on the US supporting Ukraine against Russian aggression?
questions.description: This involves providing military, financial, and diplomatic support to Ukraine in its conflict with Russia.

questions.question: How important are international alliances like NATO to US foreign policy?
questions.description: NATO (North Atlantic Treaty Organization) is a military alliance of Western countries aimed at collective defense.

questions.question: Should the US take a stronger stance against authoritarian regimes (e.g., China, North Korea)?
questions.description: Taking a stronger stance involves imposing sanctions and other measures to counteract authoritarian governments.

questions.question: Do you support continuing military aid to allies like Israel?
questions.description: Military aid includes providing weapons, training, and financial support to allied countries.

questions.question: Should the US prioritize human rights in its foreign policy?
questions.description: Prioritizing human rights means making the protection of human rights a central goal in international relations.

questions.question: Should there be a pathway to citizenship for undocumented immigrants?
questions.description: A pathway to citizenship means creating a process for undocumented immigrants to become legal citizens.

questions.question: How should the US handle border security?
questions.description: Border security involves measures to prevent illegal immigration, drug trafficking, and other security threats.

choices.value: Strengthen border security, but also focus on legal immigration

questions.question: Do you support DACA (Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals)?
questions.description: DACA protects eligible immigrant youth from deportation and provides work permits for a period of time.

questions.question: Should the US increase the number of refugees it accepts?
questions.description: Accepting more refugees involves allowing more people fleeing persecution or conflict to resettle in the US.

questions.question: How important is it to integrate immigrants into American society?
questions.description: Integration involves helping immigrants adapt to and become part of American culture and society.

questions.question: What are your views on criminal justice reform?
questions.description: Criminal justice reform involves changes to policies and laws to address issues like mass incarceration and police practices.

questions.question: How important is it to address systemic racism and promote racial equality?
questions.description: Addressing systemic racism involves tackling institutional practices that disadvantage racial minorities.

questions.question: Do you support policies like affirmative action to promote diversity?
questions.description: Affirmative action involves policies that aim to increase opportunities for underrepresented groups.

questions.question: Should law enforcement agencies be reformed to address issues of police brutality?
questions.description: Reforming law enforcement includes changes to policies and training to prevent excessive use of force.

questions.question: How important is it to ensure equal pay for equal work regardless of gender or race?
questions.description: Equal pay for equal work means ensuring that individuals receive the same pay for the same job, regardless of their gender or race.

questions.question: Should college be more affordable and accessible through government funding?
questions.description: Making college more affordable involves government subsidies and grants to reduce tuition costs.

questions.question: How important is increasing funding for public education?
questions.description: Increasing funding for public education means allocating more government resources to K-12 schools.

questions.question: Do you support student loan forgiveness programs?
questions.description: Student loan forgiveness involves canceling some or all of a student's debt.

questions.question: Should early childhood education be expanded and funded by the government?
questions.description: Expanding early childhood education means increasing government programs for children before they enter kindergarten.

questions.question: How important is it to provide free or low-cost vocational training and apprenticeships?
questions.description: Vocational training and apprenticeships provide practical skills and work experience in various trades.

questions.question: Should the US continue providing financial and military aid to Ukraine?
questions.description: Providing aid to Ukraine means sending financial support and military equipment to help in their conflict with Russia.

questions.question: Do you believe in maintaining a strong stance against authoritarian regimes globally?
questions.description: A strong stance means implementing policies to counteract the influence of authoritarian governments.

questions.question: How important is it to support democracy and human rights in foreign policy?
questions.description: Supporting democracy and human rights means prioritizing these values in international relations.

questions.question: Should the US push for stronger sanctions against Russia?
questions.description: Sanctions are penalties imposed on countries to influence their behavior.

questions.question: Do you support increasing NATO presence in Eastern Europe?
questions.description: Increasing NATO presence means deploying more troops and resources to Eastern Europe to deter aggression.
